page.title: 10Housing & Housing Provision
page.content: g) Strathaven Road at Cadzow Bridge 1910's - replaced Miners' Rows. {TYPES OF HOUSING} Older developments are grid pattern Semi-detached. Then we move on to cir- cular patterns (Eddlewood, Fairhill) followed by the latest trends at Woodhead with segregated traffic and pedestrians. Few if any shops built in areas. Garages only built in later develop- ments (Meikle Earnock, Woodhead). Housing is typically Local Authority terraces, semi-detached, low rise flats. No tower blocks. Some Meikle Earnock housing was built for letting at "Economic" rents. Many of these have now been purchased by their tenants. Most people seemed happy with their housing, but{not}with their rent and rates.
